title: Strengthening the Nation's Forests, Communities, and Local Economies

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to protect and restore mature and old-growth forests on public lands, reduce wildfire risks, and support sustainable forest-based economies, including indigenous and local communities. It also commits the U.S. to combat international deforestation through coordinated government actions and promotes nature-based solutions to address climate change and environmental resilience.
potential_concerns: Defining and inventorying old-growth forests may delay immediate protective actions due to complexity and jurisdictional disputes.
Balancing wildfire risk reduction with forest conservation could lead to conflicts over use of active management and prescribed burns.
International efforts to restrict commodities linked to deforestation may face trade pushback and complicate diplomatic relations.
Implementing collaborative, community-led economic plans may be challenging across diverse regions and sectors with competing interests.
Ensuring sufficient funding and interagency coordination for the ambitious reforestation and conservation goals may face bureaucratic and budgetary obstacles.
